intro: Nothoscordum pedersenii, commonly known as the Pedersen's false garlic, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous underground stems and grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Nothoscordum pedersenii is often found in rocky or sandy soils in arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
